top_categories.workout_context: Kal-Tour Dirty 100 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
At 100 miles, Kal-Tour Dirty 100 punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Kal-Tour Dirty 100’s michigan rolling, local event demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Kal-Tour Dirty 100. Make this intensity feel like home.
Racing Kal-Tour Dirty 100 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Kal-Tour Dirty 100 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
At 100 miles, Kal-Tour Dirty 100 rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Every session at Kal-Tour Dirty 100 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Kal-Tour Dirty 100’s michigan rolling gravel delivers on race day.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Kal-Tour Dirty 100 — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Tempo is the race-day intensity of Kal-Tour Dirty 100. Harder than Z2, easier than threshold — the pace you’ll hold for hours on michigan rolling gravel.
The varied gradients at Kal-Tour Dirty 100 reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Kal-Tour Dirty 100’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Kal-Tour Dirty 100 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on michigan rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: michigan rolling, local event, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Durability, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 100 miles of michigan rolling gravel in Kalamazoo, Michigan.
